programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: An unpredictable experiment to install lights at Charlotte Motor Speedway results in a game-changing moment for motorsports and one of the most dramatic finishes in NASCAR history.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: “This Racing Life” explores how racing binds communities together and what drives the quest of young racers to make it into NASCAR.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: Neil Bonnet was an American racecar driver in the top series of NASCAR, but due to an accident went into TV and entertained fans in a whole new way before his untimely death.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: FOX Sports Films presents a dynamic look at the history of the renegade drivers in NASCAR and the outlaw spirit engrained in the sport.

programme.title: RISING
programme.desc: Three of NASCAR’s Rising stars are thrown into the fire as they take on the most famous and dangerous track in America - Daytona to kick off the season. Go deep inside the lives of Rajah Caruth, Jesse Love, and Carson Hocevar as they prepare for the biggest race of the season. Who will triumph and who will crash and burn?

programme.title: RISING
programme.desc: After his disastrous day at Daytona, Carson Hocevar changes his tune and dazzles the NASCAR world with his aggression in Atlanta. Learn more about where Rajah Caruth comes from as well as his philosophy on the peaks and valleys of a NASCAR season. Jesse Love prepares for his NASCAR cup debut on the golf course with fellow driver Connor Zilisch.

programme.desc: Nash and Joe track down a band of female bank robbers; Nick voluntarily moves into a nursing home.

programme.title: Firecreek
programme.desc: Johnny Cobb (James Stewart) is the part-time sheriff in a small, rundown town, trying to stretch his meager salary to provide for his growing family. Poor Cobb isn't much of a gunman, and he isn't particularly suited for fighting, but he's the man in charge when a gang of bandits led by Bob Larkin (Henry Fonda) rides into town. The tension rises as the bandits make themselves at home in Cobb's town, but when a gunfight breaks out, Cobb finds himself pushed to the limit.

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: Hollister investigates when a disheveled prison escapee comes to town and declares his innocence.

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: Hollister agrees to bring a fatally wounded freedom fighter's brother to him before he dies.

programme.desc: Lucas welcomes his old friend Tom Birch, who once saved his life, unaware that the man is now a bank robber on the run with his gang.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Dan Maury, released from Yuma prison, arrives in North Fork intent on getting even with Marshal Torrance, who helped send him to jail.

programme.title: The Rifleman

programme.desc: A madman steals ten cases of dynamite from the city arsenal and announces his intention of reducing New Orleans to rubble. A beautiful widow visiting town claims to be a witness to the explosion, but Yancy is suspicious of her motives.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: River pirates, led by the beautiful Coco LaSalle, attacks and robs Yancy's boat, stealing a diamond necklace belonging to the Mexican government. In order to recover the necklace, Yancy makes a deal with LaSalle and escorts her to the masked ball for Mardi Gras.

programme.title: Bat Masterson

programme.desc: A U.S. marshal (Kirk Douglas) leads a lynch-mob survivor, his daughter (Virginia Mayo) and others across the desert to justice.

programme.desc: Near the end of the Civil War, Julia Hayne (Miriam Hopkins) travels to Libby Prison to convince Cmdr. Vance Irby (Randolph Scott) to help transport gold from Virginia City to the South. Union intelligence agent Kerry Bedford (Errol Flynn) breaks out of the prison and, learning of the plot for the gold, travels to Nevada, meeting Julia on the way. Sensing Julia is attracted to Kerry, Vance asks her to help set a trap while desperados led by Murrell (Humphrey Bogart) also close in on the gold.

programme.desc: Zorro helps two Indian servants who wish to wed.

programme.desc: Don Alejandro's brother-in-law attempts to con the guests of a party given in his honor by selling them imitation jewels.

programme.desc: Jim Bowie has a fling in New Orleans? high society, climaxing in a duel with a count over a glamorous aristocrat whom Bowie fancies.

programme.desc: Jim Bowie takes a detour on a trip home from Christmas when a thief steals the gift he was taking to his mother. In pursuit, he lands on a plantation where he is mistaken for someone.

programme.title: Fort Worth
programme.desc: Reformed gunman Ned Britt (Randolph Scott) travels to Fort Worth, Texas, to take over the abandoned newspaper. Crooked trail boss Gabe Clevenger (Ray Teal), a former antagonist of Ned's, challenges him on the trail. Ned refuses to fight -- which disappoints fellow passenger Flora Talbot (Phyllis Thaxter), who had taken a liking to him but now sees him as weak. In Fort Worth, Ned discovers Clevenger is battling the burgeoning railroad and decides to fight back using the power of the press.

programme.title: Riding Shotgun
programme.desc: Larry Delong (Randolph Scott) loses his sister and her son when they're gunned down by the notorious Dan Marady (James Millican) and his band of outlaws during a holdup. Delong takes a job as a stagecoach guard, hoping to run into the bandits and take revenge. Run into them he does, but numbers are on Marady's side, and they shoot up and rob Delong's coach. Delong barely escapes with his life. When he tries to alert the authorities, they implicate him in the crime, and he becomes a fugitive.

programme.title: Tall Man Riding
programme.desc: A few years ago, Larry Madden (Randolph Scott) left his fiancée, Corinna (Dorothy Malone), after a run-in with her father, the wealthy land owner Tucker Ordway (Robert Barrat). After saving a man (William Ching) from a vicious attack, Larry learns hen is actually Corinna's new husband, and that some of the locals are preparing to challenge Tucker's land ownership. When Larry decides to ride back into town and make a claim himself, he encounters a few unexpected obstacles.

programme.title: Thunder Over the Plains
programme.desc: It's the late 1860s, and the U.S. government has yet to reclaim Texas as a state. A group of opportunistic and amoral Northerners head south to claim the territory as their own. Though Texas lawman Capt. Porter (Randolph Scott) believes it's his duty to honor the local leaders, he can't ignore the corruption of the Yankee politicians who are giving him orders. When Confederate veteren Ben (Charles McGraw) is unjustly sentenced to death, Porter decides he has had enough of his new bosses.

programme.title: The Man Behind the Gun
programme.desc: An Army major (Randolph Scott) goes undercover to stop a plot to make Southern California a separate state.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Night of the Blood Beast" (1958) Cult. An astronaut returns full of monster embryos; with Michael Emmett, Angela Greene, John Baer.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Teenagers From Outer Space" (1959) Science fiction. Alien teens with ray guns land on Earth to breed their lobsterlike space cattle. With David Love, Dawn Anderson, Harvey B. Dunn.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: After a scientist acquires a device to control men's minds, a feline hero tries to stop his plot to rule the world in "The Puma Man.".

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: The trio sit through a dreary Joe Don Baker disasterpiece as Gypsy tries to find a way to save Joel from being killed by the Mads.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: A weather tech's mind gets trapped in a computer and Pearl establishes her own public television pledge program.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police discover the dead body of Andrew Hopper clutching a syringe and covered with blood. The body is in Dr. G's hands, as are the clues to solving the case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: 58-year-old Leroy Williams is rushed to the ER by his wife after becoming disorientated. Doctors work tirelessly, but Leroy slips into a coma and eventually dies.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: 69-year-old widower, Ernesto Vasquez is found dead on his porch with a loaded gun, a knife and three empty pill bottles.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A hotel clerk calls 9-1-1 complaining of severe facial trauma, but he has no recollection of what happened and dies soon after. Police are counting on Dr. G to aid them in this investigation.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When Dr. G receives Lea Conrad's body, she suspects the woman may have died from an antihistamine overdose. Then, Dr. G learns that Lea was being treated for lupus.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A neighbor hears odd sounds coming from the next apartment. When police arrive, they find a man bruised and dead. When all signs point to foul play, it's up to Dr. G to find proof of murder.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Parents rush their baby to the hospital, but she tragically dies in her mother's arms. Now, Dr. G must help these devastated parents understand what happened.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A 71-year-old man wakes in the middle of the night, gasping for air. Paramedics rush to save him, but it's all in vain: he's dead by the time they arrive. What caused his death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. Farley discusses the bizarre case of a pregnant mother who suddenly dies. As the autopsy unfolds, Dr. Farley uncovers information that could have saved her and her unborn child's life.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: 69-year-old widower, Ernesto Vasquez is found dead on his porch with a loaded gun, a knife and three empty pill bottles.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A hiker stumbles across a man's dead body in the woods. The victim's brother is convinced he was murdered. Dr. G must get to the bottom of this case. Was foul play really involved?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When an infant dies under mysterious circumstances, the young parents are prime suspects. Dr. G discovers several clues that bolster the child abuse theory, but the case is not clear cut.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G suspects that someone is responsible for a vagrant's unusual death. She'll only discover the truth by finding answers to the strange events surrounding this curious case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: After driving to his parent's house, Cameron Walker finds his dad dead in bed, and his mom bound in the closet.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Leo Guzman falls off a ladder while painting a house. At first, his death seems to be an open-and-shut case but, as the autopsy unfolds, Dr. G believes there may be more to this case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A mother of infant twins notices that her son is not breathing. EMTs attempt to revive him, but it's too late. Now, Dr. G must work fast to determine if the other twin's life is in danger.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: After suffering an apparent seizure, 37-year-old Ruben Delgado is found lifeless by his girlfriend.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A daughter wants to surprise her dad with breakfast in bed but finds him unresponsive. His family is convinced they know what killed him, but Dr. G must let the evidence speak for itself.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: After driving to his parent's house, Cameron Walker finds his dad dead in bed, and his mom bound in the closet.

programme.title: Baggage
programme.desc: Contestants on this dating game show don't want to hear the elimination line "I'm sorry, but you have too much baggage." How much is acceptable among three contestants in each episode is determined by the "dater," who hears the candidates' intimate secrets and hidden flaws, as well as their attempts to deflect these traits by describing their positive attributes. After two elimination rounds leave one remaining contestant, it's the dater's turn to reveal his or her own baggage ... and then the contestant decides to go forward with the date or not. Jerry Springer hosts.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose “Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk” training comes into play.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the second 'Celebrity Special' of the season. This time, all of them face 'The Qualifier'.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: One couple battle to turn a clay-clogged building site in Sussex into a piece of Portugal. Another tackle a forest of overgrowth in their new back garden in Cadeby. They are determined to create a productive space, something they have always wanted.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: A truck driver from Wakefield with a passion for flowers wants to create a perfect outside space for his girlfriend and burgeoning family, while in Swindon a widow wants to find the best way of turning her bleak patch of green into a cottage garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty travels to two corners of the country where the challenges he faces are very different. On the south coast he is presented with a front garden ravaged by salty winds, and in Snowdonia he helps a mountainside garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty helps two families create dream gardens that are as much for the children as for the adults. In Doncaster, Nikki and John want a garden full of edible plants and fruit.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty faces some of the most surprising plans yet - a Norwegian garden complete with waterfalls to be fashioned out of a tiny back yard in Dorset, and nothing less than a Japanese tea garden to be created out of a patch of ground in Bromley.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares for his spring display and tackles slippery paths, Carol Klein visits a collection of Michaelmas daisies and we visit a veg grower with a show-stopping Halloween pumpkin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the clocks going forward this weekend, there's an extra hour of gardening to enjoy. Monty makes the most of this as he begins to sow dahlia seeds for summer flowers, reveals a new project and shows what to plant now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After an extraordinary season, Monty's orchard has a bountiful harvest of apples and he gives advice on how to pick and store them. Frances Tophill makes a final visit to her shared allotment and joins in with the festivities at their annual show. Adam Frost visits the RHS garden Wisley where he meets the Curator to discuss the effects of summer. Nick Bailey investigates knotweed, one of the most pernicious weeds in the UK, Arit Anderson provides inspiration for colourful late season containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the first day of spring and Monty has sharpened his tools in readiness to open the gardening year, accompanied, of course, by Nigel and Nellie. He reflects on how Longmeadow has fared during an extraordinarily wet winter and gets going on a few essential tasks to get the garden into gear for the seasons to come.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: A celebration of the snowdrop, with a visit one of the world's largest collections, lovingly nurtured in a suburban back garden. Plus, Monty gives tips on what to do once they have finished flowering. Nick Bailey revels in the beauty of magnolias.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Join the team as they present the seasonal highlights from across the country visiting stunning gardens, meeting the gardeners and finding out their secrets of success. Adam Frost presents from his garden and suggests essential gardening jobs for the weekend.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost is in his garden providing inspiration for gardens, along with all the essential gardening jobs for this weekend.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team present seasonal highlights from across the country, visit stunning gardens, meet the gardeners and find out their secrets of success. Monty, Nigel and Nellie are at Longmeadow, discussing the weekend's gardening jobs.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets involved in more seasonal tasks at Longmeadow. Carol Klein celebrates the spring highlights at Beth Chatto's Gardens in Essex, and Toby Buckland is in Cornwall to meet a gardener who fell out of love with gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on the plants that need winter protection and thinks ahead to colourful spring bouquets. The glory of summer may be over in most gardens, but Carol goes to Worcestershire in search of some autumn colour.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the clocks going forward this weekend, there's an extra hour of gardening to enjoy. Monty makes the most of this as he begins to sow dahlia seeds for summer flowers, reveals a new project and shows what to plant now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his favourite winter veg, Joe Swift discovers AJ Odudu's passion for houseplants, and Sue Kent and Toby Buckland take an inspirational trip to Piet Oudolf's garden in Somerset.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings; Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey; Arit Anderson discovers how rewilding can increase biodiversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets involved in more seasonal tasks at Longmeadow. Carol Klein celebrates the spring highlights at Beth Chatto's Gardens in Essex, and Toby Buckland is in Cornwall to meet a gardener who fell out of love with gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn gathers momentum, it's time to start putting the garden to bed for winter. Monty Don has some timely advice on what to do. Carol Klein meets a nurseryman in Herefordshire and together they indulge in the beauty of the Japanese maple.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's in the jewel garden showing which plants need protection from the elements now and which ones can be left until after the first frosts. programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: For Ali and Rush, one of the best aspects of fishing is being able to share experiences on the water with interesting people. On this episode we invite luxury watch enthusiast Eric Rivera - AKA "Watch Eric" to the Florida Keys to target Permit and Amberjack in the Gulf.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali and Rush head to the Bay Flats Lodge in Seadrift Texas to fish the vast shallow water marshes of the San Antonio Bay for Redfish. With thousands of acres of lowland creeks and pools to explore, this premier lodge has the tools and techniques it takes to get the guys their shots at this skinny water species.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali heads East to fish for the usual in Key West, but Rush always has another trick up his sleeve.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The ability to overcome obstacles and challenging conditions can be key to success, but when fishing in Key West, cold temps are rarely the hurdle. For Rush and Ali, it's another day on the water where patience and a plan pays off with Cobia and Amberjack action that gets the rods bent after a cold weather spell in the Keys.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With slow pitch jigging being the newest craze, Rush and buddy Dane head out to test some new tackle and go for “mutton or nothing.” Meanwhile in California, Ali gets his hand on the new gear and prepares to hop a flight and join in on the “slow pitch” party with the guys in Key West.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Early winter in Key West means wahoo is on everyone’s mind and Ali and Rush are ready to put in the lures and the time to get it done. Once the conditions line up it’s time to go all in, wahoo or bust.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by MMA fighter Clay Guide for the exciting variety of Barracuda, Sharks and Jacks in the Middle Keys Channel Flats.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by young guide Richard Black as he leads them to a backcountry slam.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by young up and coming guide Anthony Vargas, who puts them on a wide variety of game fish in the Keys backcountry.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Key West guide Nick LaBadie, a talented guide with a special knack for finding permit on the Key West flats.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by New York Cop Mike Counihan, who brings his passion for fitness and fishing along as the crew take on sharks in the Middle Florida Keys flats.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor rise early for a full day of adventure in the Keys, rocking the sunrise for baby tarpon, scoring on some mid-day permit, and watching the sun go down in search for big tarpon.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss is ready to tango with the Sailfish of Stuart, Florida.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Heavy hearts find comfort in cherished memories as the Local Knowledge crew mourns the loss of one of the greatest members of the fishing industry. Looking back on several of our episodes with our dear friend Dave Salazar, we celebrate the life of this amazing fishermen, family man, and visionary behind the world renowned Casa Vieja Lodge.

programme.title: Flavor on the Fly
programme.desc: Welcome to Flavor on the FlyIn the first installment of our newest original series, Chef Ranga Perera trades the towering Rockies for the rolling hills in the Green Mountain State. Out of his element and on a mission to find inspiration for new dishes that embody both the spirit of Vermont and his Sri Lankan roots, Ranga meets with a myriad of enthusiastic characters; each eager to share a small slice of the place they call home. Perch nuggets, sharp teeth, and hot peppers - see what lies in store for our host in the first-ever episode of “Flavor on the Fly.”

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: In this episode, we will highlight what’s being done in the Florida Keys to protect and save the reefs. We will show innovative solutions researchers have created to protect the coral and showcase the recovery that’s taking place.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float plane—a new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, “the land of earth, sea, and sky.” All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaska’s abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. There’ll be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for now—join us—there are halibut to filet, rainforest ’shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Establishing themselves just after the last Ice Age, the blacktail of Vancouver Island offers an important genetic population isolated from the mainland. To explore the local relationship with the species, its harvesting, conservation and history, Dan Cabela travels to the island.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson set off to hunt the American Alligator in eastern Texas. A species that was placed on the endangered species list in the 1960s, their populations are now thriving. Kyle and Jeff have agreed to help remove some problem gators off private land owned by their friend Troy, but things get rowdy when Kyle loses a bet and has to swim with the very gators he is hunting.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Description: A look back at one of our best seasons yet, @Dr Duck and Billy Campbell travel the country chasing waterfowl mostly on Public land. Drop us a comment on your favorite hunt of the year. We can't wait to run it back next year.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The guys move across the south hunting ducks in Texas and Oklahoma ahead of a major push of cold weather across the country.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: From battling towering 12-foot waves in the Gulf of Alaska, to reeling in colossal 200 lb. halibut, they discover firsthand the rugged beauty of America's 49th state. This episode highlights Lindell Yachts as a top builder of rugged offshore sportfishing yachts, as well as Radon Boats as great pilothouse fishing and guide boats.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team does a deep dive into a product founded by Engineered Marine Coatings called the Genius Bucket. The Genius Bucket being the ultimate DIY paint kit for those looking to tackle a marine painting job on there own. The team also checks out the capabilities it takes to restoring the older metal rub rail which derived from the Glastron project.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh and George from Two Georges Marina battle the wind and tide on a tough day of fishing which leads Josh to fish another day, solely for revenge on the Sheepshead!

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike heads to one of the most prolific fisheries in SW Florida; South Seas Island Resort.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed for the opportunity to follow along the guys from Trinity Oaks for Bucks for the Brave. The men and women that served in our armed services and as first responders, had jobs that required the, to be willing to sacrifice their own lives every day, in order to protect or save someone else's. Not many of us can say that, nor understand what that truly means. The things they've had to see, and the sacrifices they've made in their daily lives, can have a profound impact on them. Trinity Oaks' Bucks for the Brave platform allows the loved ones and communities that support these heroes to share their stories and unite us all in honoring and recognizing their service to our great nation. We are proud to continue to be a part of this incredible program, getting these heroes in the outdoors for the hunt of a lifetime.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Another great hunt this week with Intrepid Care. We have the chance to hang out with some Veterans from all over the country. We gather to tell stories, build relationships, and just enjoy the great outdoors. This trip is action packed and the guys are chasing South Texas hogs from the ground.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: John Sewell has played a huge part in the development of feeding Fortified Cottonseed 365 days a year. Laramie Barrett of Fortified Cottonseed joins John for a great weekend of hunting at his ranch in Uvalde, Texas. This is a great time for Laramie to get away from the office and see the first hand of how their product is performing.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: They say you come to New Zealand as a stranger, but leave as family. In this episode of DIRT, the crew goes full circle—meeting Muttonbird chefs Emma and George on the South Island before hopping up to Raglan and working their way back down. Water skiing next to snow-capped mountains, cooking in hot springs the Māori way, and stargazing at Wairarapa Dark Sky Reserve are all on the itinerary. But it’s the final “Feed” done Kiwi-style that makes one thing clear—in this unique and stunning land, nobody’s a stranger for long.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation
programme.desc: “Part of our responsibility as citizens in this country is to make sure we not only take care of these resources but we hand it off to the next generation in better condition that we found it.” -Bob Ziehmer, Senior Director of Conservation for Bass Pro Shops & Cabela's Join Bob in New Mexico as he talks about taking care of our natural resources for future generations. Special thanks to Express UU Bar Ranch

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: Join Bryan Brown, Rigsby Stewart, and Chase Herndon along with Lee Ellis on our annual opening week hunt in Northern Nebraska. Big Bucks were spotted and a tag was punched on an unexpected buck on opening day!

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: Join Rigsby Stewart, and Chase Herndon on our annual opening week hunt in Northern Nebraska. Big Bucks were spotted and Rigsby punched his tag on a big 10 point on day 4.

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: Atlanta Braves 3rd baseman Austin Riley trades the baseball diamond for the wide-open west as he joins Tyler Jordan in Montana on an epic whitetail bow hunt. It's the ultimate game of cat and mouse as Austin and Tyler try to get a monster buck in bow range.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: The father-son duo of Mike and Sam Crane hunt with Tyler Jordan and Ole Miss football players Eli Acker and Jaxson Dart. The action starts off slow, but the duo got it done late in the morning with a Mississippi double.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: With Meredith McCord halfway around the world, Capt. Justin Leake gives show producer Chris Hermans his first shot at landing a tarpon after filming them for 9 seasons. Does art imitate life?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake joins some old friends on board the Fall Line in hopes of scoring big in the Bay Point Billfish Open. This trip will test the limits of all the anglers as the skilled captain and crew do the impossible in hopes of bringing home the prize.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin and Florida WaterSports pro Jeff Lange go deep off Panama City Beach to test the limits of a new battery powered reel. The results are surprising.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When tarpon don’t cooperate, it’s time for Capt. Justin and friend Ethan Register to have a competition for dinner options in the gulf’s grocery store.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team heads over to FGCI FiberGlass Coatings to learn about their innovative product, Paintable FiberGlass. This will be used to help touch up some scratches in the Taco Marine Project boat. We also receive very helpful maintenance tips to keep you running smoothly when out on the water.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team highlighted deck repair and antique motor restoration, including storage solutions and structural enhancements.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and part of the old Trained Assassins Crew, Luke Mitchell (producer) and Ryan Wascom (host), head out to Colorado to chase bugling elk with their bows. Also joining the crew is one of Slade’s real estate clients and his son. Part of the deal when this client worked with Slade was that Slade lined them up an elk hunt the following fall. It is an amazing week at camp with five arrows being sent down range and multiple elk hitting the dirt. You do not want to miss this one.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we are super busy juggling the turkey season opener, but we also have our real estate convention in Gulf Shores Alabama, multiple listing videos to complete, and property showings. It happens every year to us, spring kicks off and people want to have properties of their own knowing dog gone well it’s the most wonderful time of the year. TURKEY SEASON! It’s a jam up of a week. You’re not going to want to miss it.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

programme.title: Huntstand Presents
programme.desc: Massive wildfires had consumed thousands of acres across the Bighorn Mountains and the neighboring foothills. Would the annual HuntStand pronghorn camp be a total bust, or would the crew be able to find a few animals beyond the smoke?

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Will Cooper finally trades 3 years of tough times for triumph in his quest to tag an out-of-state buck with a bow.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Justin Martinovich heads home to his family's cranberry farm in Wisconsin to lend a hand in harvest—and chase after bog-country whitetails with his crossbow.

programme.title: HuntStand TIps and Gear
programme.desc: Join Cody Butler for a deep dive into ground blind strategies for bowhunting turkeys. Discover essential tips and tactics for bagging big toms with your bow from ground blinds. Learn about optimal blind placement for a successful turkey hunt.
If you hunt big whitetails this is a must see! Follow Adam Hays and Lee Lakosky as they hunt for multiple giants and learn some tactics for harvesting monster whitetails!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: The 2024 turkey season has arrived. Slade and Bentley are already off to a great start. Bentley managed to take one down opening weekend for youth hunt. And Slade took one down opening day. This episode features an inside look into Slade’s life filled with real eastate and the great outdoors.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode we take you behind the scenes of production for one of the biggest and baddest listings Slade has ever gotten - Southside Land Company in Jefferson County, MS. Hunter Phelps comes down from Kentucky to help film, and Slade puts him on 2 Mississippi gobblers.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade shows us around some of his investment properties, and Ryan kills a nice bull elk in New Mexico.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike and Capt. Glenn Taylor fish their home waters and pay tribute to dear friend Capt. Billy Nobles.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt Mike meets up with Leiza Fitzgerald and Jimmy Huddleston for a star tournament redfish tag mission.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Long time friends Mike and Danny find a hot top water bite.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike Reed with Midwest Whitetail gets a shot at “Vinny,” a legendary 171-inch whitetail buck he's been hunting all season. Watch the story unfold as months of strategy, patience, and hard work come together in a single, heart-pounding hunt.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: In Missouri, we join Avery Epperson on the home farm with one goal in mind—catching up with a legendary buck known as Old Monroe. It doesn’t take long before the hunt heats up as the crew spots their target and works to grunt him into bow range. Hunting over a lush green plot on the home farm, Avery gets the chance every whitetail hunter dreams of.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon Simmons is passionate about catching the mighty Sailfish, andgoes out with his tournament partner and former MLB star, Doug Mankietwicz. Doug has won a World Series and Olympic Gold medal, and now is in search of some Sails.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon takes outdoorsman Zac Yarbrough to look for blackfin tuna and then out deep for swordfish. They are joined by Styles Haury for some epic offshore action.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Colten & Mark Scroggins is in Oklahoma during the peak rut, chasing mature whitetail bucks! With bucks on the move and searching for does, it's the perfect time to break out the calls. Watch as Mark and Colten pull out all the stops—getting aggressively loud with the WoodHaven "Intimidator" Grunt Call—to turn a cruising buck and bring him right into bow range at the blind.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: On a crisp Iowa November morning, everything comes together as Drake Lamb with Midwest Whitetail grunts in a massive 8-point buck that he encountered before with the WoodHaven Midwest Grunter. This is one hunt you don’t want to miss!

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: Justin Miller deployed to Iraq twice in his Army career, when he returned home he faced a new battle; Post Traumatic Stress. Justin has his own personal battles with PTS, but he has now found a way to help countless more veterans in their battle through an organization he co-founded called Operation Objective Zero.

A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed for the opportunity to follow along the guys from Trinity Oaks for Bucks for the Brave. The men and women that served in our armed services and as first responders, had jobs that required the, to be willing to sacrifice their own lives every day, in order to protect or save someone else's. Not many of us can say that, nor understand what that truly means. The things they've had to see, and the sacrifices they've made in their daily lives, can have a profound impact on them. Trinity Oaks' Bucks for the Brave platform allows the loved ones and communities that support these heroes to share their stories and unite us all in honoring and recognizing their service to our great nation. We are proud to continue to be a part of this incredible program, getting these heroes in the outdoors for the hunt of a lifetime.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Another great hunt this week with Intrepid Care. We have the chance to hang out with some Veterans from all over the country. We gather to tell stories, build relationships, and just enjoy the great outdoors. This trip is action packed and the guys are chasing South Texas hogs from the ground.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: John Sewell has played a huge part in the development of feeding Fortified Cottonseed 365 days a year. Laramie Barrett of Fortified Cottonseed joins John for a great weekend of hunting at his ranch in Uvalde, Texas. This is a great time for Laramie to get away from the office and see the first hand of how their product is performing.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: They say you come to New Zealand as a stranger, but leave as family. In this episode of DIRT, the crew goes full circle—meeting Muttonbird chefs Emma and George on the South Island before hopping up to Raglan and working their way back down. Water skiing next to snow-capped mountains, cooking in hot springs the Māori way, and stargazing at Wairarapa Dark Sky Reserve are all on the itinerary. But it’s the final “Feed” done Kiwi-style that makes one thing clear—in this unique and stunning land, nobody’s a stranger for long.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation
programme.desc: “Part of our responsibility as citizens in this country is to make sure we not only take care of these resources but we hand it off to the next generation in better condition that we found it.” -Bob Ziehmer, Senior Director of Conservation for Bass Pro Shops & Cabela's Join Bob in New Mexico as he talks about taking care of our natural resources for future generations. Special thanks to Express UU Bar Ranch

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: Join Bryan Brown, Rigsby Stewart, and Chase Herndon along with Lee Ellis on our annual opening week hunt in Northern Nebraska. Big Bucks were spotted and a tag was punched on an unexpected buck on opening day!

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: Join Rigsby Stewart, and Chase Herndon on our annual opening week hunt in Northern Nebraska. Big Bucks were spotted and Rigsby punched his tag on a big 10 point on day 4.

It is an amazing week at camp with five arrows being sent down range and multiple elk hitting the dirt. You do not want to miss this one.

You’re not going to want to miss it.

programme.desc: Join Cody Butler for a deep dive into ground blind strategies for bowhunting turkeys. Discover essential tips and tactics for bagging big toms with your bow from ground blinds. Learn about optimal blind placement for a successful turkey hunt.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: In Missouri, we join Avery Epperson on the home farm with one goal in mind—catching up with a legendary buck known as Old Monroe. Hunting over a lush green plot on the home farm, Avery gets the chance every whitetail hunter dreams of.

programme.title: Life On The Water

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Colten & Mark Scroggins is in Oklahoma during the peak rut, chasing mature whitetail bucks! With bucks on the move and searching for does, it's the perfect time to break out the calls. Watch as Mark and Colten pull out all the stops—getting aggressively loud with the WoodHaven "Intimidator" Grunt Call—to turn a cruising buck and bring him right into bow range at the blind.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way

programme.title: The Island Of Dr. Moreau
programme.desc: A deranged scientist performs genetic experiments with horrific results.

programme.title: Beyond the Poseidon Adventure
programme.desc: The S.S. Poseidon lies belly-up while the passengers fight to survive.

programme.title: Mr. Nanny
programme.desc: A retired wrestler must survive an impossible job when becomes the nanny to kids whose favorite game is finding ways to force their nanny to quit.

programme.title: Revolution
programme.desc: In 1776, a fur trapper reluctantly takes up arms to fight for freedom when his son is imprisoned during the violent struggle against the British.

programme.title: The Accidental Tourist
programme.desc: A travel writer hates to travel and loves order, until everything changes.

programme.title: The Lazarus Project
programme.desc: A reformed thief is drawn back into a burglary-gone-wrong that lands him on death row, until he mysteriously wakes up in a psychiatric hospital.

programme.title: The Fog
programme.desc: A deadly fog terrorizes the residents of a small bayside town as its ghastly secret of merciless revenge takes them over and must be unraveled.

programme.title: The Nines
programme.desc: A troubled actor, a television show runner, and an acclaimed video game designer find their lives intertwining in mysterious and unsettling ways.

programme.title: Maximum Risk
programme.desc: A police officer and his twin brother's fiancée team up to expose an international conspiracy in this erotic, globe-hopping adventure.

programme.title: Cowboy Up
programme.desc: Follow the tumultuous life of two brothers, Ely, a rising rodeo star, and Hank, a rodeo clown, as they make their way through the bull riding circuit.

programme.title: Stand by Me
programme.desc: In summer 1959, four boys set out on a two-day trek in search of a missing dead body. The journey will test them in ways they had never imagined.

programme.title: Crossroads
programme.desc: Dreaming of being a famous R&B guitarist, a young virtuoso seeks out a legendary musician and must convince him to teach him the ways of the blues.

programme.title: Fire on the Mountain
programme.desc: A stubborn rancher in his twilight years takes on the U.S. government when the Air Force tries to expropriate his New Mexico land for a missile range.

programme.title: Finding Graceland
programme.desc: A grieving and guilt-ridden recent widower finds himself on a road trip to Memphis after picking up a hitchhiker who claims he’s Elvis Presley.

programme.title: Lake Placid 2
programme.desc: As fierce giant male crocs and a feisty female guarding her eggs return to the lake, the sheriff, a big-game hunter, and a wildlife officer step up.

programme.title: Company of Heroes
programme.desc: Set during World War II, Company of Heroes, follows US military units during the Battle of Normandy and the Allied liberation of France.

programme.title: No Mercy
programme.desc: A Chicago cop looking to avenge the death of his partner heads to New Orleans and kidnaps the killer's mistress by handcuffing himself to her.

programme.title: 7 Seconds
programme.desc: Wesley Snipes stars as a skilled art thief who has to come up with a rescue plan when his partner is kidnapped in retaliation for their crimes.

programme.title: Desperate Measures
programme.desc: A cop seeking a bone marrow transplant for his gravely ill son finds a match. But the potential donor is an incarcerated killer with ulterior motives.

programme.title: Bad Country
programme.desc: Set in 1983, this is the tale of a Baton Rouge detective who uses an informant to infiltrate the most sinister criminal enterprise in the South.

programme.title: The Principal
programme.desc: After taking a bat to the Porsche of his ex-wife’s divorce attorney, teacher Rick Latimer is punished with a principal post at a violent high school.

programme.title: Toy Soldiers
programme.desc: The teen action classic about a group of troublesome students from an exclusive prep school who defend it when Colombian terrorists lay siege to it.

programme.title: The Solid Gold Cadillac
programme.desc: A small stockholder-turned-corporate heroine ousts a crooked Board of Trustees and reinstates an honest director, falling in love along the way.

programme.title: Let's Do It Again!
programme.desc: In this 1953 musical remake of The Awful Truth, a recently-divorced couple try every way to make each other jealous.

programme.title: The Amazing Mr. Williams
programme.desc: Homicide detective Kenny Williams (Melvyn Douglas) is so attached to his police work that his longtime fiancée, Maxine Carroll (Joan Blondell), wonders if he would rather solve a case than get married. When Maxine convinces the police captain (Clarence Kolb) to threaten Kenny with suspension, Kenny shows his dedication by accepting a case requiring him to dress as a woman. With a killer on the loose, Kenny must decide between his career obligations and his fiancée's wishes.

programme.title: The Silencers
programme.desc: It's up to secret agent Matt Helm to save the day when a megalomaniac and his dastardly organization plot to sabotage America's atomic missile system.

programme.title: Harriet Craig
programme.desc: A cold, perfectionist wife will stop at nothing to have her house and life run as she wishes, even if it means controlling her husband's every move.

programme.title: Bell, Book and Candle
programme.desc: A Greenwich Village witch falls for her dashing neighbor. When she learns he’s engaged, she casts a love spell but risks losing her powers for good.

programme.title: Phffft!
programme.desc: A divorced couple hopes to move on after their split, but fate has other plans. They’re dating other people, but they keep running into each other!

programme.title: American Madness
programme.desc: During the Depression, the bank owned by generous Dickson (Walter Huston) is barely staying afloat, and things get worse when $100,000 is lifted from the vault. Fingers are pointed at reformed crook Matt (Pat O'Brien), who got a job and a fresh start from Dickson. The innocent Matt can clear his name by admitting that on the night of the robbery he was breaking up a tryst between Dickson's wife and another teller. But this revelation may crush Dickson, and Matt's conscience plays tug-of-war.

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared
programme.desc: When a kerfuffle over fine wine exports upends their tiny nation's economy, the prime minister and grand duchess of Fenwick declare war on the U.S.

programme.title: The Last Hurrah
programme.desc: An aging New England mayor is defeated in a hard-fought reelection campaign involving shady transactions by both political groups.

programme.title: Under the Yum-Yum Tree
programme.desc: The machinations of a lusty landlord threaten the bliss of a couple trying to determine their character compatibility by living together platonically.

programme.title: Rusty Leads the Way
programme.desc: With the help of his canine buddy, Rusty, a kind, young kid performs good deeds for people and befriends a blind girl in the process.

programme.title: First Men in the Moon
programme.desc: Convinced they’re the first men on the moon, three astronauts discover evidence of a lunar landing decades earlier and track down its sole survivor.

programme.title: A Raisin in the Sun
programme.desc: Sidney Poitier stars in this iconic version of the famous play about a cash poor family who start to fray when they inherit a life insurance payout.

programme.title: Walk, Don't Run
programme.desc: During the Olympics, an electronics expert learns his hotel room will not be available for two days, and is forced to share an apartment with a woman.

programme.title: Only Angels Have Wings
programme.desc: Rough and tough Geoff Carter (Cary Grant) runs a tiny airline that cannot afford to miss any flights, despite the dangers along many of the routes. When Bonnie Lee (Jean Arthur), a performer who is falling for him, sees that Geoff is preparing to fly in violent weather conditions, she takes measures to make him stay. She's successful in her attempt, and two of his employees are forced to make the flight for him -- but Bonnie may have been correct about the potential peril of that flight.

programme.title: Shut My Big Mouth
programme.desc: An Eastern milquetoast (Joe E. Brown) takes on outlaws in the Wild West.

programme.title: Indian Uprising
programme.desc: Gold thieves and the government rile Geronimo, despite a cavalry captain's (George Montgomery) efforts at peace.

programme.title: Coroner Creek
programme.desc: A gunfighter (Randolph Scott) loses his beloved in a robbery and hunts the man (George Macready) to blame, who is living off the loot.

programme.title: The Pathfinder
programme.desc: Based on the novel of the same name, a scout is sent by the British to infiltrate a French stronghold near the Great Lakes in the 1750s.

programme.title: The Durango Kid
programme.desc: The cowboy hero (Charles Starrett) with a secret saves settlers from rustlers in his movie-series debut.

programme.title: The Nevadan
programme.desc: After fleeing a sheriff's escort to jail, an outlaw thief crosses paths with a mysterious stranger and a greedy rancher en route to his stash of gold.

programme.title: Sierra Stranger
programme.desc: Jess Collins, a poor miner, helps Sonny chase off two men he calls claim jumpers. When he arrives in the nearby town, he learns Sonny is no good and everyone in town is against him.

programme.title: The Tall T
programme.desc: The victims must outsmart their cruel captors after an outlaw, and his gang kidnap an heiress, her nervous husband, and a rancher.

programme.title: Cowboy
programme.desc: A Chicago hotel clerk smitten with the daughter of a trail boss’s business partner goes on a cattle drive with him to Mexico through the real West.

programme.title: The Hard Man
programme.desc: A Texas Ranger (Guy Madison) turns deputy sheriff; a woman (Valerie French) wants him to kill her cattle-baron husband (Lorne Greene).

programme.title: Jubal
programme.desc: Searching for work, cowboy Jubal Troop (Glenn Ford) arrives in a small town, where he badly injures his hand. Fortunately, a local rancher, Shep Horgan (Ernest Borgnine), is willing to employ Troop despite the injury. Horgan and Troop work together amicably, but Horgan's two-timing wife (Valerie French) threatens to create discord when she becomes interested in Troop, although he really loves another woman. A jealous cowhand (Rod Steiger) complicates matters by spreading lies.

programme.title: Lightning Guns
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) investigates the murder of a banker who was about to loan a rancher some money for a controversial dam project.

programme.title: The Man From Tumbleweeds
programme.desc: Ex-convict gunfighters join a state ranger (Bill Elliott) on patrol for outlaws.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: Across the Sierras
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok (Bill Elliott) offends his betrothed (Luana Walters) when he shoots a bad guy on his trail.

programme.title: Massacre Canyon
programme.desc: A cavalry officer and two of his men set out to make sure that a shipment of guns safely reaches its destination.

programme.title: Hands Across the Rockies
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok and his sidekick Cannonball meet a woman who is scheduled to marry the murderer they are trailing.

programme.title: Gunman's Walk
programme.desc: Rancher Lee Hackett (Van Heflin) spends so much time trying to keep the violent streak of his son Ed (Tab Hunter) in check, he neglects the needs of his other son Davy (James Darren). When Ed's temper results in the death of an innocent Native American, Lee tries his best to cover his son's tracks by making a deal with unscrupulous horse trader Jensen (Ray Teal), who falsely testifies on Ed's behalf. But it becomes clear that Ed can't change, and a shootout between father and son ensues.

programme.title: The Fighting Frontiersman
programme.desc: A Texas Ranger learns that the prospector who found Santa Ana's treasure has been captured by gold thieves.

programme.title: The Bandit of Zhobe
programme.desc: After Maj. Crowley (Norman Wooland) arrests the warrior Kasim Khan (Victor Mature) under suspicion of attacking British troops, Khan escapes. While he is away, a rival warlord, Azhad Khan, dresses his troops as British soldiers and attacks Kasim's village, killing his family. Thinking that the British are behind the attack, Kasim wages war against them. Only Crowley's daughter, Zena (Anne Aubrey), with help from her guard, Stokes (Anthony Newley), sees that Kasim is not the enemy.

programme.title: Sergeant York
programme.desc: Recruited to fight in World War I, a Tennessee farmer with deep pacifist beliefs is driven to take up arms when his unit is overwhelmed by Germans.

programme.title: Please Don't Eat the Daisies

programme.title: The Valley of Decision

programme.title: The Crimson Pirate

programme.desc: When a missing artifact seems to be the key to solving a double murder, a conspiracy theorist (Jorge Garcia) helps the team.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Carver Valley’s comic festival is in full swing when the village is shocked by the murder of a former supermodel. With a scathing comic shaming several villagers as the only lead, Barnaby and Winter are left trying to separate fact from fiction.

programme.desc: Barnaby gets to relive his former days of sporting glory when a death at the local Rugby Club sends Barnaby and Winter into a muddle of rucks, old grudges, new romances… and artisanal chocolates?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is less than impressed when Sarah drags him to a family friend’s wedding. But things soon go from bad to worse when tragedy strikes and Barnaby is called into action to catch a murderer with an apparent penchant for local brides.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer is buzzing with excitement at the arrival of the annual ‘Paramount Dance Extravaganza’. But behind the sequins and smiles are deep running feuds and passions.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Fishermen and women flock to the village of Solomon Gorge desperate to catch a giant fish that is said to lurk in the lake.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: After a local photographer wins an urban myth competition with his creation of The Wolf Hunter, it unexpectedly gains a cult following. However, when a man is killed, Barnaby and Winter must investigate if this myth has become murderous reality.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A local outcast, who was controversially acquitted of murder years earlier, is the latest inductee into a post-operative heart rehab club. Following his arrival, members' dreams of a second chance at life begin to be cut short.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the owners of Karras Games gather for a murder mystery weekend, the immersive experience takes a puzzling twist when a killer strikes for real. The police's detective skills are put to the test as they are forced to solve this case on their own.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The annual Midsomer Scarecrow Festival takes a grisly turn as bodies begin appearing on poles displayed alongside their straw creations; the investigation reveals rivalries that run deep and shows people will do just about anything to win.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Midsomer Mummers, an amateur operatic society, rehearses for its charity concert when the body of an unknown man is found in the theatre; the investigation quickly becomes a race to discover who is desperate to take centre stage.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Each year, the village of Angel's Rise hosts the Psychic Fayre. Founded by the Saint-Stephens family in memory of their late daughter, the event attracts mediums, psychics and followers of the occult. When a body is found surrounded by ritual symbols on the eve of the festival, Barnaby must step into the spiritual world to find the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a survivalist is found murdered in his bombproof shelter, Barnaby unravels a dark conspiracy to reveal how far people will go to escape the end of the world.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: As the Barrett-Jackson Auction gets into full swing, the auction block sees a surge of American Made cars. Everything from Chevy Corvettes to Ford Mustang Mach 1s, and even a 1927 Ford Model-T Popcorn Truck cross the auction block!

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Electric vehicles take center stage; a line-up of classics, trucks, customs, and more, selling at no reserve.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Super Saturday continues full speed ahead as bidders desperately chase the car of their dreams; prices keep rising with the 2018 Ford GT '67 Heritage Edition and the 2018 Ford Bronco VIN001.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: From trucks to hot rods and muscle cars, customs of every flavor take center stage in Las Vegas, rolling across the block and pushing prices sky high.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Barrett-Jackson is back in Palm Beach, Fla., with everything from collector classics to modern marvels.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Roadsters, Superbirds, and Porsche 911s are the main attraction, but a Fast Attack Buggy from "Fast & Furious 7," a replica John Deere Tractor, a Little Gem Travel Trailer, and a Divco Custom Milk Truck are also sure to turn heads.

programme.desc: Barrett-Jackson returns to Palm Beach and brings the best moments from this year's auctions.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby Stanga attempts to upgrade his logging empire, so he tries out some new equipment; DJ Jeremiah just may provide the spark the Rygaard has been missing; Triack's production is slowing down because of steep terrain and narrow logging roads.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby uses an airboat to search for century-old logs; Rygaard attempts to move a six-ton cypress; David's sons hold down the fort while he delivers a load of logs to the mill; the Dreadknots suffer a late-day accident.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby tries to repair his custom-made buggy; David Zitterkopf makes a dangerous swing between trees; the Dreadknots go logging in the night; Triack is at a disadvantage when a crew member is injured.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Louisiana, Shelby and his assistant Bob go out looking for logs on his repaired swamp buggy; In Central Florida, the Chapman crew goes to fight against the legendary Gump log.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby goes to Lake Ponchartrain with Belinda and Bob to obtain a huge log he marked years ago; In Florida, it's round two for the Chapman and Gump log; things go from bad to worse for the bare bones Rygaard crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Rygaards go old school to keep the team on track; Shelby and Bob find a valuable sinker cypress; the Zitterkopf crew tries to take on a dangerous tangle of logs known as "the teepee of death."

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In the Louisiana Bayou, Shelby Stanga's jet boat is in serious need of repair; in Washington, Gabe takes a risk and hires a wild card veteran logger; in Alaska, the Papac team is battling the elements mother nature is throwing their way.

programme.title: Ax Men

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby Stanga attempts to upgrade his logging empire, so he tries out some new equipment; DJ Jeremiah just may provide the spark the Rygaard has been missing; Triack's production is slowing down because of steep terrain and narrow logging roads.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Rygaard logging has started to claw its way back up the log count thanks to DJ Jeremiah, but today he's a no show; In Alaska they need to fill the seat in the yarder soon; Shelby Stanga is still without his Jetboat.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby Stanga still doesn't have his jet boat, but fortunately he has his trusty assistant Davi; the Papac crew is struggling to remain atop the King of the Mountain leaderboard, they're moving to the toughest section on their site.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby gets his jetboat back, and it now has a new engine that will help him get the job done; Rygaard is still struggling and Gabe is forced to promote his inexperienced crew, which could mean disaster.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The battle for King of The Mountain roars on; the Rygaard crew has an issue with getting the wood to the mill; Papac has to negotiate a dangerous unpredictable downhill site and mother nature isn't helping make it any easier.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The race for logs gets hot as Papac go into their most daunting site yet; at Rygaard, the crew tries to string a road over a steep draw using a device called a knife.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: A devastating injury at Rygaard rattles the crew and threatens to stop production; Shelby's jet boat is back and it's time to go hunting; Triack is under pressure to finish their site before their permit expires.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A compilation of the best scenes from all 11 seasons of A&E's hit series Duck Dynasty.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie and the guys take John Luke golfing prior to his engagement party, their attempts at marital advice don't exactly work out as planned.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase receives a palate of fireworks as a gift, he and the guys create a homemade fireworks display for the Robertson family 4th of July barbeque. Meanwhile, Uncle Si is honored by the veterans association and given his own exhibit at a local military museum.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Phil and Jase get into an argument about which type of duck decoy works best, Jase and the guys repaint some old decoys, betting that Phil cannot tell the difference. Meanwhile, Jessica challenges Willie to a bowling contest with Kay's "Big Sista's" club.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase and the guys discover they have a knack for removing pests from other people's property, they use their new talents to their advantage. Meanwhile, Willie gives Sadie and John Luke summer jobs at his diner, but first he must train them to be good employees.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When an office prank war spirals out of control, Phil volunteers Willie, Jase, and Jep to help Alan at the church, which seems more like a punishment than charity work. Meanwhile, Korie gives Kay a surprise art class taught by famous artist Pierre Matisse.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the guys spend the weekend at a hunting cabin to celebrate Martin's bachelor party, things turns explosive after they find a cache of antique black powder weapons. Meanwhile, Willie helps Kay fulfill her lifelong dream of owning a petting zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Uncle Si has a brush with death, he creates a bucket list and asks the guys to help him fulfill his dreams. Meanwhile, Kay sets out to prove to Willie and Alan that she actually graduated high school.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Duck Commander sponsors a NASCAR race, Jase and the guys get themselves in the mood by attempting to work as a pit crew. Meanwhile, Willie and Korie challenge John Luke and his fianc Mary Kate to a doubles tennis match.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: In this very special wedding episode, John Luke Robertson is getting married to his fiancé Mary Kate, and our cameras are with him every step of the way.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Missy's parents visit, her father convinces Jase to take him on a quail hunt. But while their "bonding hunt" yields very few quail, it does bring them closer together as friends.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Si recruits his nephews to help him transport a storage container to his backyard, but things take a turn when Jep becomes locked inside the box.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie's old rival Phillip McMillan challenges him to a game of dodgeball, Willie recruits his family members to settle a score once and for all.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase and Phil make a bet about whether or not human beings in a duck blind are visible from the air, Jep buys a drone copter to get a "bird's eye" view, but ends up losing it in the process.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and the guys convince Willie to hire his older brother Alan to work at Duck Commander, but when Alan begins micromanaging everyone, they quickly change their mind.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the Robertsons throw a Renaissance Fair birthday party for Godwin, various family members compete in a tournament to win knighthood.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: In this special episode, the Duck Commander team surprises two wounded veterans with a trip to Monroe so they can be in an episode of Duck Dynasty. To show their support, the Robertson family stages a "color run" to bring awareness to our wounded soldiers.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie and Alan agree to help Miss Kay open her own bakery, but things take a turn when it Kay is asked to hand over her secret recipes.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Missy and Jase's son Reed purchases an old van to boost his music career, his parents begin to question some of his choices.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie and his brothers spend too much time frog hunting, their wives challenge them to a "frogging" competition.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertson family takes a road trip to Liberty University where they will drop off John Luke and Mary Kate for their first year of college. Along the way, they stop in Nashville to visit Willie's friend Colt Ford.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Alex Debogorski confronts a creek that's thawed in the middle of the road. On an important run for Polar, Art Burke receives news that could be devastating.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Facing a season expected to be one of the shortest on record, both teams are under pressure.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: With only two weeks left of the winter season, the race is on to deliver the remaining loads before the ice roads melt away.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Looking to expand their company, Darrell Ward and Lisa Kelly head into Alberta and onto a trail nicknamed "The Death Road."

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's just over a month into the new ice road season and more than 800 truckers are on the ice, working around the clock.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Darrell Ward faces a trail nicknamed the obstacle course. Todd Dewey struggles to clear a melting ice bridge.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: On her first ever solo trip, Polar rookie Steph Custance braves one of the longest ice crossings on the winter roads map. An engine fire stops Lisa Kelly dead in her tracks.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The ice road season is off to a bad start. Legendary trucker Alex Debogorski gets more than he bargained for when he falls through a patch of thin ice.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: A sudden warm up threatens to derail the ice road season just as it kicks into high gear. Alex Debogorski encounters a mystery man walking alone on an isolated winter road.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: After rising temperatures close the ice roads the drivers are stranded and praying for a freeze.
